content: closing 2 increase around 12 sts 10 decrease around 6 sts 3 *single_crochet increase* around 18 sts fo leaving tail for weaving 4 *single_crochet 2 increase* around 24 sts weave tail through front loops of 5 - 7 single_crochet around 24 sts 3 rnds 6 sts pull snug weave tail 8 in blo *single_crochet 2 decrease* around 18 sts www southerngalscrochet com crochet organizer 4 front tray worked in the round chain 20 1 single_crochet in second chain from hook single_crochet 7 sc3tog single_crochet 7 3 single_crochet in last chain now working on the bottom of the chain single_crochet 8 3 single_crochet in next st single_crochet 8 increase in the first chain 40 sts see special instructions 2 increase single_crochet 6 sc3tog single_crochet 6 increase x 3 single_crochet 9 3 single_crochet in next st single_crochet 9 increase x 2 46 sts 3 in blo single_crochet around 46 sts mark the flo st # 19 4 - 5 single_crochet around 46 sts 2 rnds fo leaving tail for sewing tray trim trim assembly this can be done with one strand but for extra stability i used 2 strands attach yarn to first flo of tube #1 single_crochet 16 sts 16 sts do your next single_crochet in the first flo of tube #3 single_crochet 12 13 sts do your next single_crochet in the marked st of the tray piece single_crochet 27 28 sts www southerngalscrochet com crochet organizer 5 do your next single_crochet in the first flo of tube #2 single_crochet 8 9 sts slip_stitch to beginning and fo with extra long tail for sewing bases together pin all the pieces together and sew in the flo of each piece beginning with tube #1 to tube #2 i hope the drawing is helpful with those tails from each piece sew or tack the pieces together weave ends and fill it up with all your supplies ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ tadda you re done i hope you enjoyed making my crochet organizer feel free to sell your finished item a little shout out as the designer would be nice please respect my work by not sharing the written pattern but please share my link instead go to www southerngalscrochet com and sign up for my monthly newsletter
